answers.1:
Sure, here's the answer to your question:

This bill provides continuing appropriations to prevent a government shutdown if an appropriations bill for a fiscal year has not been enacted before the fiscal year begins and continuing appropriations are not in effect.

The bill provides continuing appropriations at 94% of the rate for the preceding year for the first 90 days of the fiscal year. It then reduces the continuing appropriations by 1% after the first 90-day period and by an additional 1% for each subsequent 90-day period until the applicable appropriations legislation is enacted.

The bill is currently in the Senate and has been referred to the Appropriations Committee.
answers.3:
Sure, here's the answer to your question:

The sponsor of the Government Shutdown Prevention Act of 2025 is Senator Paul, Rand [R-KY] (R).

* This amendment is consistent with the provisions of H. Res. 211.

answers.1:
This bill provides continuing FY2025 appropriations for federal agencies and extends various expiring programs and authorities. It is known as a continuing resolution (CR) and prevents a government shutdown that would otherwise occur if the FY2025 appropriations bills have not been enacted when the existing CR expires on March 14, 2025.

The bill is currently in the process of becoming a Public Law. It was signed into law on March 11, 2025, and became effective immediately.
